tweets.text: @EnvAgencySW Which River Frome and where?

We have been dealing with pollution of the River Frome where 600l of heating oil affected a kilometre of the river. The source has been stopped and pollution contained by our booms while Wessex Water take away oily residue. https://t.co/h36pIj1xjT

We inspect regulated businesses every day to ensure they meet their obligations to protect people and the environment. This landfill at North Cave, inspected this week, has a good performance and work to restore it to one of Europe's largest wetland areas is progressing well https://t.co/uykzackTXI

You never know what you are going to find when doing #CCTV surveys of culverts! This mass of tree roots was located by our contractors @drainsIDS during a camera survey today on the #Hemington Brook #Leicestershire. This will be a challenge to remove. #floodrisk #winterreadiness https://t.co/Op9EoQl7Le

We inspect regulated businesses every day to ensure they meet their obligations to protect people and the environment. This landfill at North Cave, inspected this week, has a good performance and work to restore it to one of Europe's largest wetland areas is progressing well https://t.co/uykzackTXI

A great deal has changed in the UK since the devastating South Yorkshire flooding in November 2019, but some of the worst affected are still having to deal with the problems it caused. I spoke to a few with @MarkAnsell, marking one year on: https://t.co/ZKrAi9r17t

Chernobyl: #bumblebees still at risk from #radiation nearly 35 years on. Feat. #UofStirling's Dr Katherine Raines via @ConversationUK  Read the full story üëáüêùhttps://t.co/11aV7Y3AfX @NERCscience @anchorage40 @EnvAgency @rwm_gdf_uk @SRP_UK

It's not only our rivers that are having sewage dumped into them. Our beaches are in as just a filthy state.

Well done everyone at @sascampaigns https://t.co/JjxjrXV19K

As hosts of #COP26, we're committed to protecting and restoring our natural environment.

We're working #TogetherForOurPlanet with @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm and others to deliver the Nature Recovery Network and create better connected spaces for nature üåø https://t.co/e6wIperqa2

Has lockdown freed up some time? Together with @ninaconstable we made a short film series in celebration of Devon‚Äôs beautiful natural habitats, in collaboration w/ @wwf_uk @NDevonBiosphere @nationaltrust @EnvAgency - good lockdown viewing! Our 1st episodeüëâhttps://t.co/qW1IlbS2XU https://t.co/tqh5TmI0lK

@SandbanksCG_ @sascampaigns @BCPCouncil @SandbanksCG_ @sascampaigns @BCPCouncil The overflow at Shore Road discharged 59 times between Oct19 & Sep20, the vast majority of which were in the winter months. This is data recorded in line with Environment Agency standards. We will happily provide you with other data on Mon.
Raw sewage dumped on UK coast nearly 3,000 times in 12 months, report says https://t.co/8iSOnaX1ba
